content:
• Thursday, July 18, 2013

  • Stocks fell sharply after the open in Japan amid selling in the futures market. The Nikkei...

    Stocks fell sharply after the open in Japan amid selling in the futures market. The Nikkei opened in positive territory, but quickly fell 3% before retracing some of the losses to trade down 0.7% at midday. Elsewhere in the region, the ASX trends 0.5% lower, the Hang Seng posts fractional losses out of the gate, and shares in Shanghai move between gains and losses in early trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 PM | 3 Comments
  • ICUI

    More on ICU Medical (NASDAQ:ICUI): Q2 misses on both EPS and revenue. Net earnings fell 19% Y/Y...

    More on ICU Medical (NASDAQ:ICUI): Q2 misses on both EPS and revenue. Net earnings fell 19% Y/Y on lower sales from its critical-care business. The company also lowered its full-year outlook. It now sees its EPS coming in at $2.50 to $2.60 on revenue of $320M to $325M. It previously projected earnings of $2.70 to $2.85per share on revenue of $330M to $337M. Shares -6.1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:14 PM
  • MBI

    Detroit pulls the plug and files for Chapter 9 bankruptcy after emergency manager Kevyn Orr...

    Detroit pulls the plug and files for Chapter 9 bankruptcy after emergency manager Kevyn Orr fails to a cut a deal with creditors. The city becomes the largest in U.S. history to file for bankruptcy. A few stocks trading lower on the news: MBI -15%, RDN -0.2%, MTG -1%, F -0.7%, GM -0.7%, MUNI -0.3%, PZA -0.5%, ITM -0.3%, HYD -0.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:57 PM | 54 Comments
  • ACTG

    More on Acacia Research (NASDAQ:ACTG): Q2 misses on both EPS and revenue, as net losses rise...

    More on Acacia Research (NASDAQ:ACTG): Q2 misses on both EPS and revenue, as net losses rise from legal fees and other costs cut into revenues from patents. Costs related to amortization of patents increased to $12.6M, compared with $5.4M in the year-earlier period. Shares -14% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:08 PM
  • MRK

    More on Cubist Pharmaceuticals (CBST): Q2 comes in mixed, missing on the bottom line but beating...

    More on Cubist Pharmaceuticals (CBST): Q2 comes in mixed, missing on the bottom line but beating on top line revenue. Net earnings fell 65% as the biopharmaceutical company was hit by higher costs that more than offset 12% Y/Y revenue growth. U.S. Cubicin sales jumped 14% to $227.1M, while Entereg sales climbed 28% to $12.4M. R&D expenses also surged however, rising 71% to $115.2M. Shares +1.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:38 PM
  • HOLX

    Hologic (NASDAQ:HOLX) says that it expects preliminary Q3 EPS to come in at $0.38, slightly...

    Hologic (NASDAQ:HOLX) says that it expects preliminary Q3 EPS to come in at $0.38, slightly above its previous guidance of $0.36. - $0.37 Street estimates of $0.37. Revenues are projected to be around $626M, which is in line with previous guidance of $625M - $630M. Analysts are looking for revenues of $626.72M. Additionally, the company names Jack W. Cumming as president and CEO, effective immediately. Cumming, who had previously served as CEO from 2001 to 2009, succeeds Robert A. Cascella, who has stepped down for personal reasons. Shares +5.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:27 PM
  • ALGN

    More on Align Technology (NASDAQ:ALGN): Q2 beats on all counts as total sales grew by over 12%...

    More on Align Technology (NASDAQ:ALGN): Q2 beats on all counts as total sales grew by over 12% Y/Y. Net earnings rose 2.9% as the maker of Invisalign braces posted higher shipments and margins widened. For the current quarter, the company expects to earn between $0.28 - $0.30 per share on revenue of around $154.9M to $160M. Analysts polled by Thomson Reuters recently predicted income of 31 cents a share and $156 million in revenue. Shares +6.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:11 PM
  • BA

    Boeing (NYSE:BA) -2% AH after a 787 flown by Japan Airlines makes an unscheduled landing at...

    Boeing (NYSE:BA) -2% AH after a 787 flown by Japan Airlines makes an unscheduled landing at Boston's Logan Airport. The FAA says a maintenance message indicator pointed to a fuel pump problem, and that the landing was "a precautionary measure." Shares fell on Friday after a 787 caught fire at London's Heathrow Airport.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:10 PM | 9 Comments
  • MATN

    Oxigene (OXGN) says the European Medicines Agency has granted orphan drug status to its ovarian...

    Oxigene (OXGN) says the European Medicines Agency has granted orphan drug status to its ovarian cancer treatment Zybrestat. Data from a Phase 2 trial testing the combination of Zybrestat and Roche's (OTCQX:RHHBY) cancer drug Avastin - to treat advanced ovarian cancer - could be available in early 2014. If the results prove positive, it could provide the basis for a registration program. Shares +32% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:02 PM
  • YELP

    Yelp (NYSE:YELP) wants to take on OpenTable (NASDAQ:OPEN): the local reviews leader is spending...

    Yelp (NYSE:YELP) wants to take on OpenTable (NASDAQ:OPEN): the local reviews leader is spending $12.7M (mostly in stock) to acquire SeatMe, owner of a Web/iPad reservation platform for restaurants and nightlife venues. Yelp notes it has ~1M U.S. business listings in the restaurant and nightlife categories, giving it plenty of reach to leverage SeatMe's platform. The announcement comes a week after Yelp launched a platform for taking orders and processing transactions, and two weeks after Groupon launched a high-end restaurant reservation service. OPEN -5.5% AH. YELP +1.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:59 PM
  • FRO

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: FRO +6%. ALGN +5%. HOLX +5%. SWKS +5%. ALNY +5%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: FRO +6%. ALGN +5%. HOLX +5%. SWKS +5%. ALNY +5%.
    After-hours top losers: ICUI -8%. PSDV -6%. ISRG -6%. OPEN -6%. MSFT -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM
  • SWKS

    Skyworks (NASDAQ:SWKS) announces a $250M buyback plan to go with its FQ3 results. The plan...

    Skyworks (NASDAQ:SWKS) announces a $250M buyback plan to go with its FQ3 results. The plan replaces a $200M program announced last November, and which had $35.6M remaining. The RF chipmaker is guiding for FQ4 revenue of $475M and EPS of $0.62, above a consensus of $470.1M and $0.60 and allaying fears stoked by Samsung, Apple, and (most recently) TSMC. A likely reason: Skyworks says it gained "connectivity and analog control IC content" with Chinese OEMs, Huawei, Lenovo, and ZTE, who have been seeing their low-end smartphone sales surge. Skyworks also says it gained sockets in Qualcomm 4G reference designs. FQ3 gross margin was 44%, +180 bps Q/Q. GM is expected to total 44%-44.5% in FQ4. Shares +5.2% AH. RFMD +1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM

  • Nasdaq 100 futures (QQQ) are down 1% in AH trading following earnings misses from Google and...

    Nasdaq 100 futures (QQQ) are down 1% in AH trading following earnings misses from Google and Microsoft; Dow and S&P 500 futures are up modestly. XLK -1.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM
  • RGA

    Reinsurance Group (NYSE:RGA): Q2 EPS of -$0.69 may not be comparable to $1.83. Revenue of $2.59B...

    Reinsurance Group (NYSE:RGA): Q2 EPS of -$0.69 may not be comparable to $1.83. Revenue of $2.59B beats by $0.11B. Shares -3.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:15 PM
  • AMD

    AMD now -3.7% AH following its Q2 report. The chipmaker is guiding for Q3 revenue to be up...

    AMD now -3.7% AH following its Q2 report. The chipmaker is guiding for Q3 revenue to be up 19%-25% Q/Q (no doubt thanks to the Xbox One/PS4 ramps). That spells a range of $1.38B-$1.45B, well above a $1.22B consensus. But expectations have risen over the last 3 months. CPU division sales +12% Q/Q and -20% Y/Y (-38% in Q1). Q/Q growth due to higher PC/server unit shipments, offsetting an ASP drop. Y/Y drop due to PC weakness, lower ASPs, and share loss. GPU division -5% Q/Q and -13% Y/Y (-12% prior); ASPs fell Q/Q and Y/Y. Thanks to restructuring, R&D spend -11% Y/Y to $308M, and SG&A -19% to $171M. Cash/investment balance -$100M Q/Q to $1.1B. (PR) (CFO comments)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:12 PM
  • ISRG

    AH losses accelerate for Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG) as the company discloses an FDA...

    AH losses accelerate for Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG) as the company discloses an FDA warning letter on its call. "The content of the letter is a reflection of two ... things [the FDA] wants insight into," management says. One concern relates to a "procedure by which recalls are classified" and the other involves "user input and design elements." The company says the concerns "are addressable." Shares -10% AH. (webcast)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM
  • CYT

    Cytec (NYSE:CYT): Q2 EPS of $1.51 beats by $0.26. Revenue of $514M beats by $11.4M. Shares -4.5%...

    Cytec (NYSE:CYT): Q2 EPS of $1.51 beats by $0.26. Revenue of $514M beats by $11.4M. Shares -4.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • SWKS

    Skyworks (NASDAQ:SWKS): FQ3 EPS of $0.54 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $436.1M (+12% Y/Y) beats by...

    Skyworks (NASDAQ:SWKS): FQ3 EPS of $0.54 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $436.1M (+12% Y/Y) beats by $0.7M. Shares +5.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM | 2 Comments
  • ICUI

    ICU Medical (NASDAQ:ICUI): Q2 EPS of $0.48 misses by $0.18. Revenue of $78.7M misses by $4.73M....

    ICU Medical (NASDAQ:ICUI): Q2 EPS of $0.48 misses by $0.18. Revenue of $78.7M misses by $4.73M. Shares -5.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • SYK

    Stryker (NYSE:SYK): Q2 EPS of $1.00 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $2.21B (+5% Y/Y) beats by...

    Stryker (NYSE:SYK): Q2 EPS of $1.00 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $2.21B (+5% Y/Y) beats by $0.02B. Shares -1.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • CMG

    More on Chipotle's (NYSE:CMG) Q2: Comparable restaurant sales rise 5.5%, net income rises 7.6%,...

    More on Chipotle's (NYSE:CMG) Q2: Comparable restaurant sales rise 5.5%, net income rises 7.6%, restaurant level operating margins slip 160 basis points. Increased traffic drives comps growth although there was one additional day in the quarter compared to last year. The company opened 44 new stores during the period. Food costs as a percentage of revenue were up on higher input costs. FY13 guidance: Low to mid single-digit comps, 165-180 new restaurants. Shares +6.17% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • AMD

    Advanced Micro (NASDAQ:AMD): Q2 EPS of -$0.09 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $1.16B (-18% Y/Y) beats...

    Advanced Micro (NASDAQ:AMD): Q2 EPS of -$0.09 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $1.16B (-18% Y/Y) beats by $0.05B. Shares +2.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • RMBS

    Rambus (NASDAQ:RMBS): Q2 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $57.9M beats by $0.9M. Shares...

    Rambus (NASDAQ:RMBS): Q2 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $57.9M beats by $0.9M. Shares +1.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • SNV

    Synovus (NYSE:SNV) looks to pay back the Treasury, announcing plans to redeem all of its $968M...

    Synovus (NYSE:SNV) looks to pay back the Treasury, announcing plans to redeem all of its $968M in TARP preferred stock. Internally available funds plus a secondary offering of $185M in common stock will fund the redemption. Shares +1.3% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • MSFT

    Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT): FQ4 EPS of $0.66 misses by $0.09. Revenue of $19.9B (+10% Y/Y) misses...

    Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT): FQ4 EPS of $0.66 misses by $0.09. Revenue of $19.9B (+10% Y/Y) misses by $830M. Shares -4.2% AH. CC at 5:30PM ET (webcast). (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 32 Comments
  • COF

    Capital One (NYSE:COF): Q2 EPS of $1.87 beats by $0.14. Revenue of $5.6B (+2% Y/Y) beats by...

    Capital One (NYSE:COF): Q2 EPS of $1.87 beats by $0.14. Revenue of $5.6B (+2% Y/Y) beats by $0.07B. Shares +1.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • GOOG

    Google (NASDAQ:GOOG): Q2 EPS of $9.56 misses by $1.22. Revenue (ex.-TAC) of $11.1B misses by...

    Google (NASDAQ:GOOG): Q2 EPS of $9.56 misses by $1.22. Revenue (ex.-TAC) of $11.1B misses by $230M. Shares -4.5% AH. CC at 4:30PM ET (webcast). (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 24 Comments
  • BYI

    Bally Technologies (BYI +4.3%) is set to finish the day higher after Stifel Nicolaus upped the...

    Bally Technologies (BYI +4.3%) is set to finish the day higher after Stifel Nicolaus upped the shares to Buy earlier today with an $85 price target. Stifel sees potential synergies from its acquisition of SHFL Entertainment (NASDAQ:SHFL), and the Street is significantly underestimating the long-run earnings power of the combined entity. The firm says its pro-forma model suggests the acquisition could be 22% accretive to its standalone FY15 BYI estimate of $4.12.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM
  • JBT

    JBT Corporation (JBT +1.8%) says its AeroTech business has been awarded contracts in excess of...

    JBT Corporation (JBT +1.8%) says its AeroTech business has been awarded contracts in excess of $15M to supply gate service systems for the King Abdul-Aziz International Airport in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia. The order includes the supply of new Jetway Air Handling Units and Pit Distribution Systems.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM
  • ICCC

    ImmuCell (ICCC -10.8%) slides after the company suspends its search for a partner for the dairy...

    ImmuCell (ICCC -10.8%) slides after the company suspends its search for a partner for the dairy cow intramammary mastitis treatment Mast Out. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM
  • DQ

    Daqo New Energy (DQ +11.7%) posts double-digit gains on the session. In industry news, China...

    Daqo New Energy (DQ +11.7%) posts double-digit gains on the session. In industry news, China says that as of July 24, it will impose tariffs on more than half of all polysilicon shipped from the U.S. and South Korea. (Previous: China to forgo tariffs on EU polysilicon)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM
  • HBIO

    Harvard Bioscience (HBIO +7.2%) posts strong gains on the session. Helping the cause is SA Pro...

    Harvard Bioscience (HBIO +7.2%) posts strong gains on the session. Helping the cause is SA Pro contributor Valuable Insights who, in a still-embargoed piece published today, says a planned spinoff of the company's regenerative medicine unit could mean significant upside for the shares, especially if management pursues a sale.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM
  • NUS

    Nu Skin (NUS +9.3%) ramps higher today after saying China has given it approval to start direct...

    Nu Skin (NUS +9.3%) ramps higher today after saying China has given it approval to start direct selling activities in five additional provinces and 30 new districts. The direct marketer has now added the Anhui, Gansu, Chonquing, Shaanxi and Yunnan provinces to its coverage. Additionally, the company says it will accelerate infrastructure plans in the region, including tripling the number of stores and sales support centres by 2015 - ahead of the previously announced 2017 target. It also plans to expand manufacturing capabilities within the market by the end of this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • TSM

    Mobile chipmakers are selling off after Nokia's Q2 Lumia and total phone sales miss...

    Mobile chipmakers are selling off after Nokia's Q2 Lumia and total phone sales miss expectations, and top foundry TSMC (TSM -8.6%) provides light Q3 guidance (revenue of $5.37B-$5.48B vs. $5.48B consensus) and a 2013 industry forecast cut to go with a Q2 beat. 3 days after Digitimes reported top TSMC clients, including Qualcomm (QCOM -2.9%), Broadcom (BRCM +0.4%), and OmniVision (OVTI -1.6%), were paring orders due to weak PC and high-end smartphone sales, TSMC says it "[expects] the IC supply chain to begin managing inventories" in 2H. MXIM -3.5%. TQNT -3.1%. RFMD -3.4%. CRUS -1.6%. Goldman is defending TSMC. Skyworks (SWKS -1.3%) reports after the bell.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM
  • CNNEF

    Canacol Energy (CAAEF.PK +3.1%) rises for a second straight session on more than triple the...

    Canacol Energy (CAAEF.PK +3.1%) rises for a second straight session on more than triple the average 10-day volume. In an article published Wednesday and out of embargo today, SA Pro contributor Caiman Valores called the stock "a deep value investment [trading] at a significant discount to net-asset-value … offering investors potential upside of 60%."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM
  • ANGI

    Angie's List (ANGI -3.8%) slides after SA contributor Xuhua Zhou argues the value of its local...

    Angie's List (ANGI -3.8%) slides after SA contributor Xuhua Zhou argues the value of its local service reviews/advertising platform is lower in the smaller markets it's expanding into, and that the company's marketing spend in such areas is likely to deliver less bang for the buck. Among other things, Zhou points out Angie's ARPU (per its Q1 10-Q) is above $125 in markets with 400K+ households, and in the $30-$40 range in smaller markets. Shares opened at new post-IPO highs this morning; Q2 results are due on July 24.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM
  • GDEN

    Lakes Entertainment (LACO +10%) pops today on heavier than normal volume, after the company...

    Lakes Entertainment (LACO +10%) pops today on heavier than normal volume, after the company announces that it will receive a $57.1M lump sum payment under a debt-settlement accord with the Shingle Springs Band of Miwok Indians. The tribe agreed to pay the cash on, or before, December 31st, and will be the final settlement of all debt owed to the company by the tribe, stemming from loans for the development of the Red Hawk Casino in Placerville, California.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM | 1 Comment
  • TSCO

    Tractor Supply (TSCO +1.4%) gets a boost from Wedbush today, who raised its price target on the...

    Tractor Supply (TSCO +1.4%) gets a boost from Wedbush today, who raised its price target on the shares to $135. The firm says that TSCO has executed solidly this quarter, and results will likely improve in H2 as the company goes against easier comps.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • MYE

    Myers Industries (MYE +8.7%) jumps to six-year high as investors signal their approval of the...

    Myers Industries (MYE +8.7%) jumps to six-year high as investors signal their approval of the polymer products manufacturer's solid 2Q beat and additional restructuring of its lawn and garden segment. Phase II adds an additional $8M in savings on top of current savings of $5M from the first part of the segment's restructuring. While there should be some benefit on the cost side this year as well from these actions, the majority of the benefits will come next year.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM
  • GAME

    Shanda (GAME +16.7%) takes off to new 52-week highs after announcing iOS mobile game Million...

    Shanda (GAME +16.7%) takes off to new 52-week highs after announcing iOS mobile game Million Arthur is already No. 3 on the App Store's chart for the top-grossing apps in China, within eight hours of launching in the country. Million Arthur, already offered in Japan, South Korea, and Taiwan, is published by Shanda's 51%-owned Actoz Soft Korean subsidiary. It topped Korean App Store charts in December. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM
  • CPRI

    Michael Kors (KORS -4%) slumps after NPD reports the high-end apparel retailer's sales growth...

    Michael Kors (KORS -4%) slumps after NPD reports the high-end apparel retailer's sales growth has slipped. FQ1 results arrive on Aug. 6.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • SOL

    ReneSola (SOL +8.4%) jumps to new 52-week highs after announcing its solar modules have been...

    ReneSola (SOL +8.4%) jumps to new 52-week highs after announcing its solar modules have been certified by Japan's Underwriters Laboratories for local use. Surging sales to Japan, a relatively high-margin solar market, have been proving a boon for Chinese vendors struggling to put an era of overcapacity and rock-bottom margins behind them.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • FRGI

    Fiesta Restaurant Group (FRGI +2.8%) ticks higher today after being initiated by Wells Fargo...

    Fiesta Restaurant Group (FRGI +2.8%) ticks higher today after being initiated by Wells Fargo with an Outperform rating. The stock has seen a huge runup since late last year, soaring over 155% since late December, 2012. Wells cites the strength of its Pollo Tropical franchise, plus accelerating unit growth and margins which will drive the shares higher over the near term.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM
  • ALSK

    Harry Long updates his SA Pro article on Alaska Communications (ALSK +3.4%) noting one of his...

    Harry Long updates his SA Pro article on Alaska Communications (ALSK +3.4%) noting one of his catalysts - FCC approval of the company's merger of its wireless assets with General Communications - took place on Tuesday. Among other large positives, it puts the company in line to receive a $100M cash payment upon closing of the deal - this for a firm with a $90M market cap! There may still be time for investors to gain as ALSK has yet to even issue a press release. The stock is ahead by 10% since Long's original June 3 essay.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • DZSI

    Midday top 10 gainers: ZHNE +46%. TTHI +35%. OSTK +22%. DQ +18%. SVU +18%. GAME +17%. LACO +16%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: ZHNE +46%. TTHI +35%. OSTK +22%. DQ +18%. SVU +18%. GAME +17%. LACO +16%. JRCC +14%. NCTY +14%. VELT +12%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: SRC -47%. JAKK -36%. GILT -13%. ICCC -12%. UTEK -11%. WPCS -10%. AXU -10%. SCSS -9%. FCS -9%. TGTX -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • NXGN

    Quality Systems (QSII +3.6%) moves up on an upgrade to Equal-Weight at Morgan Stanley. The firm...

    Quality Systems (QSII +3.6%) moves up on an upgrade to Equal-Weight at Morgan Stanley. The firm says that reimbursement pressure and increased costs have been driving physicians to join hospital markets, which has put earnings pressure on QSII, but a recent strategic evaluation by the company's board is likely give some downside support to shares in the near term.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • KEY

    KeyCorp (KEY +2.5%) continues to add to gains following an earnings beat this morning. The...

    KeyCorp (KEY +2.5%) continues to add to gains following an earnings beat this morning. The company has achieved $171M of its goal to eliminate $200M in annualized savings by the end of the year. Net interest income of $586M rose 7.7% Y/Y, though a large chunk of that gain was through branch and credit card portfolio acquisitions. NIM of 3.13% rose 7 bps from a year ago. Noninterest income of $429M fell 6.1% Y/Y. Book value/share of $10.89 gained $0.46 from a year ago. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • SNBR

    Select Comfort (SCSS -9.3%) takes a big hit today after its Q2 earnings missed the mark. Net...

    Select Comfort (SCSS -9.3%) takes a big hit today after its Q2 earnings missed the mark. Net earnings fell 42% on weaker margins and higher operating expenses.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • LNC

    The insurance sector (KIE +0.9%), (IAK +0.7%) is boosted at Deutsche Bank thanks to higher...

    The insurance sector (KIE +0.9%), (IAK +0.7%) is boosted at Deutsche Bank thanks to higher interest rates. Lincoln National (LNC +3.1%) is upped to Buy with price target hiked to $45 from $36. Price targets are also raised for already Buy-rated MetLife (MET +1.6%) and Principal Financial (PFG +0.9%), and for Hold-rated Aflac (AFL +0.5%) and Unum (UNM +1.1%). Lincoln is particularly attractive for its interest sensitivity, lower international exposure and reliance on fixed-income AUM fees.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • PODD

    Insulet (PODD -1.2%) slips on a downgrade to Underperform at Northland Securities.

    Insulet (PODD -1.2%) slips on a downgrade to Underperform at Northland Securities.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • GPC

    Genuine Parts (GPC -2.2%) slips this morning, despite a solid Q2 earnings beat. Investors are...

    Genuine Parts (GPC -2.2%) slips this morning, despite a solid Q2 earnings beat. Investors are reacting to the company's cut to its FY revenue growth forecast. It now sees FY EPS of $4.50 - $4.60, with bias to mid-lower end. Street consensus is still in range however, albeit towards the bottom-end at $4.51. The company cites an uneven econonmy and weakness in its nonautomotive business units for the lower guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • NE

    FBR's Megan Repine didn't see anything in Noble Corp's (NE +3.4%) Q2 earnings to "dissuade [her]...

    FBR's Megan Repine didn't see anything in Noble Corp's (NE +3.4%) Q2 earnings to "dissuade [her] from a positive thesis on the stock" which remains the firm's "favorite name to play the offshore drillers" considering the potential for non-core assets spinoffs and dividends — there's also "room for utilization improvement."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain (GMCR +3.2%) rallies amidst reports Nielsen's latest 4-week data indicates K-Cup...

    Green Mountain (GMCR +3.2%) rallies amidst reports Nielsen's latest 4-week data indicates K-Cup sales growth is accelerating. Lower prices could be helping out. GMCR's FQ3 report arrives on Aug. 7.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 1 Comment
  • CYS

    CYS Investments (CYS -3.9%) takes last night's report of a big drop book value hard despite the...

  • EBAY

    Needham downgrades eBay (EBAY -6.4%) to Hold following its Q2 revenue miss and light Q3...

    Needham downgrades eBay (EBAY -6.4%) to Hold following its Q2 revenue miss and light Q3 guidance, citing international softness and "slowing Marketplace fundamentals." Though granting eBay is taking steps to revamp Marketplaces, the firm doesn't "expect any single investment to serve as a momentum-changing catalyst in the near term." Top-rated sellers (22% Q2 same-store sales growth) and mobile (2M new users, 5.6M listings/week, $20B+ in 2013 transactions expected) remain areas of strength for Marketplaces. Amazon (AMZN -1.2%) continues to follow eBay lower, but Overstock (OSTK +15.7%) is soaring after trouncing Q2 estimates and reporting a 170 bps Y/Y increase in gross margin to 19.7%. (eBay transcript)

Canaccord downgrades the shares to Sell from Hold as analyst Nicholas Campbell says the company could be out of cash by Q3 and may need to renegotiate the Keno Hill agreement with Silver Wheaton. AXU said Wednesday that Bellekeno silver production was 576,155 ounces during Q2 but CEO Clynt Nauman reminded investors that "metals prices are expected to have [a negative impact] on financial results for the quarter." AXU says it will suspend operations at the site prior to the onset of winter in order to "avoid selling silver at current or weaker market prices."
